AboutBusiness.title: Why Your Business Needs More Than Just a Website‚ÄîIt Needs a Sales-Generating Machine
AboutBusiness.introParagraph1: In today‚Äôs digital world, your website isn‚Äôt just an online brochure‚Äîit‚Äôs your business‚Äôs most powerful sales tool. Yet, too many business owners settle for generic, do-it-yourself website builders that leave them frustrated and stuck with a site that looks nice but doesn‚Äôt actually bring in customers.
AboutBusiness.introParagraph2: If your website isn‚Äôt attracting visitors, building trust, and converting sales, it‚Äôs not just a bad website‚Äîit‚Äôs costing you money every single day.
AboutBusiness.harshRealityTitle: The Harsh Reality: A Bad Website is Worse Than No Website
AboutBusiness.harshRealityText: Think about the last time you searched for a business online. Did you land on a website that looked outdated, took forever to load, or made it hard to find what you needed? You left. That‚Äôs exactly what happens when potential customers encounter a poorly designed website.
AboutBusiness.harshRealityListItem1: ‚ùå Makes you look unprofessional ‚Äì First impressions matter.
AboutBusiness.harshRealityListItem2: ‚ùå Loses customers to competitors ‚Äì A slow or confusing site drives customers away.
AboutBusiness.harshRealityListItem3: ‚ùå Wastes your time & money ‚Äì DIY builders often leave you with a site that doesn‚Äôt work properly.
AboutBusiness.harshRealityListItem4: ‚ùå Doesn‚Äôt show up on Google ‚Äì Poor SEO means potential customers can‚Äôt find you.
AboutBusiness.harshRealityListItem5: ‚ùå Fails to convert visitors into paying customers ‚Äì Your site should generate leads and sales.
AboutBusiness.benefitsTitle: What a High-Performing Website Can Do for Your Business
AboutBusiness.benefitsIntro: A high-performing website should be your hardest-working employee, working 24/7 to attract, convert, and retain customers.
AboutBusiness.benefitListItem1: ‚úÖ Build trust & credibility ‚Äì A sleek, modern site boosts your professional image.
AboutBusiness.benefitListItem2: ‚úÖ Attract more customers ‚Äì Expert SEO drives consistent traffic.
AboutBusiness.benefitListItem3: ‚úÖ Convert visitors into customers ‚Äì Clear, persuasive design guides actions.
AboutBusiness.benefitListItem4: ‚úÖ Work on all devices ‚Äì A mobile-friendly site reaches a wider audience.
AboutBusiness.benefitListItem5: ‚úÖ Scale with your business ‚Äì Custom solutions grow with your needs.
AboutBusiness.packageTitle: What‚Äôs Included in Your Custom Website Package?
AboutBusiness.finalCallTitle: Ready to Take Your Business to the Next Level?
AboutBusiness.finalCallText: A bad website is costing you sales every single day. Don't let another customer slip away. Invest in a high-converting website today and watch your business soar.

faq.question: Can I switch plans later?
faq.answer: Yes, you can request an upgrade any time.

faq.question: Do you offer discounts?
faq.answer: We offer special pricing depending on your needs and project size. Feel free to contact us at ekoforge@gmail.com for more information.

faq.question: What is I am not satisfied with the work?
faq.answer: If you arent happy, we wont be either. We will work with you to make sure you are satisfied with the work. If we cannot come to an agreement, we will refund your money. However, no refunds will be given after the project has been turned over to the client.

faq.question: What payment methods do you accept?
faq.answer: We accept bank transfer, mobile pay, and more.

Positions.title: Open Positions
Positions.subtitle: We're always looking for talented individuals to join our growing team.

FullStackDeveloper.title: Full Stack Developer
FullStackDeveloper.description: We're looking for a proactive Full Stack Developer to build and enhance high-quality web applications. This role is fully remote, offering a generous commission-based compensation structure where earnings directly reflect your performance. You‚Äôll use modern tools like React, TypeScript, and Next.js to deliver efficient, scalable, and innovative solutions. Ideal candidates are self-driven, results-oriented, and thrive in environments with minimal bureaucracy and maximum creative freedom.

SalesRepsentative.title: Sales Repsentative
SalesRepsentative.description: We're seeking a dynamic and results-oriented Sales Representative to join our fully remote sales team. With a generous commission structure, your earnings directly reflect your sales performance. You'll focus on building client relationships, generating leads, and closing deals efficiently and effectively. Ideal candidates possess strong communication skills, negotiation capabilities, and a proven ability to deliver results in a streamlined, performance-driven environment.

LeadGenerationSpecialist.title: Lead Generation Specialist
LeadGenerationSpecialist.description: We are seeking proactive Lead Generation Specialists to identify and cultivate potential client relationships. This fully remote role offers a commission-based structure, rewarding you directly for each successful lead conversion. Ideal candidates excel at prospecting, networking, and outreach, and are motivated by clear, merit-based incentives. Join us to leverage your networking skills in an environment focused on simplicity, efficiency, and impactful results.

flightPlan.title: Flight Plan
flightPlan.description: The written Flight Plan (FPL) is submitted online via the ANS Finland website. Remember to confirm your plan by calling the Helsinki-Vantaa briefing. Click the link below to pre-fill the FPL form with the basic details of the club's aircraft.

error.fetchFlightPlans: An error occurred while fetching flight plans.

FlightPlanList.GeneralResourcesDescription: Access general resources for flight planning and aviation weather.
FlightPlanList.GeneralResourcesDescriptionTwoText: Here you will find equipment instruction documents, etc.
FlightPlanList.GeneralResourcesDescriptionThreeText: Here you will find fleet-specific information lists.
FlightPlanList.GeneralResourcesDescriptionFourText: Here you will find international flight planning resources.

section1.title: International Flight Planning Considerations
section1.content: When flying internationally, consider possible landing and navigation fees as the Finnish seasonal pass system does not cover expenses abroad. These costs are usually paid by credit card or cash at the destination briefing. Airport staff are friendly and can assist if needed. Fueling abroad is charged against the club's hourly rate ‚Äì however, credit cards tucked away in aircraft manuals might not be ideal. It's advisable to carry cash as a precaution and retain the fuel receipt ‚Äì you can get reimbursed for the fuel invoice upon returning home by submitting a free-form application in the flight preparation area with your bank account number attached with the fuel receipt.

section2.title: Written Flight Plan
section2.content: Always remember to file a written flight plan for international flights. The plan must be submitted at least one hour before crossing the national border. Since the Schengen Agreement covers most neighboring countries, this is usually the only formality required for border crossing.

section3.title: Water Area Crossings
section3.content: Each seat in the club's aircraft is equipped with life vests containing CO2 cartridges (commonly known as 'pop vests') that must be used when crossing water areas. Regulations require them for crossings of water bodies longer than 50 nautical miles, but it is advisable to wear them whenever flying a considerable distance away from shore.

section4.title: Estonia
section4.content: Estonia is part of the EU and the Schengen Area, so customs and passport formalities are not a concern. You can begin your flight from any airport in Finland and land at any airport in Estonia. Estonia, especially from the perspective of Malmi, is an excellent travel destination ‚Äì even a short flight offers plenty to see. Tallinn has higher landing fees compared to, for example, airports in Saaremaa.

section5.title: Sweden
section5.content: Sweden is also part of the EU and the Schengen Area, so the procedure is the same as for Estonia. If you plan to fly to several airports in Sweden, it might be worthwhile to purchase a local 'weekly pass' that covers landing fees at most airports at a reasonable bulk price for a week. The Swedish Transport Agency's flight planning website provides weather, Sweden's AIP, and NOTAMs for our western neighbor.

section6.title: Latvia
section6.content: Riga is a popular destination ‚Äì a vibrant European city just a couple of hours away by flight, and a common stopover for many summer vacation flights. In addition to Riga International Airport, there is also the older Riga airport, Spilve, located closer to the city. Fuel was not available from Spilve during the summer of 2012, although landing fees were only around ten euros. The airfield is PPR! Unfortunately, Latvia poses challenges regarding 100LL fuel (practically only from Riga), but diesel-powered aircraft face no issues. As Latvia is part of Schengen, a written plan alone is sufficient.

section7.title: Lithuania
section7.content: In Lithuania, air traffic control also provides information about other aircraft outside of controlled airspace. The fees are reasonable and generally lower than in Latvia. The availability of 100LL fuel is slightly better, but still requires planning. Popular destinations include Palanga, known for its sandy beaches, Klaipeda ‚Äì from which a short flight takes you to Kuurinkynnes, and Kaunas, where there is fueling availability along with an AFIS-like service at the general aviation field S. Darius and S. Girƒónas (Aleksotas).

section8.title: Eurocontrol AIP Service
section8.content: Eurocontrol, the cooperative organization responsible for European airspace, offers a service that provides the aviation manuals (AIP) of member states in PDF format. This service requires free registration. Additionally, Eurocontrol's website offers a list of direct links to the individual AIP services of the member states.

error.fetchInternationalFlightPlans: An error occurred while fetching international flight plans.

section3.title: Electronic flight log and billing
section3.body1: All flights must be recorded in the aircraft's travel logbook and electronic flight log at
section3.body2: Enter information immediately after the flight and double-check the details. Billing is done monthly via email. Ensure your email address is up to date.
section3.body3: We reconcile the aircraft book with the electronic log at least monthly. Ensure correct calculation of flight and total times. Student and instructor must verify block times match with training records.

section4.title: Personal accounts
section4.body: The club website now uses the same login credentials as the booking system. If using a shared computer, do not select 'stay logged in' when logging in.

section5.title: Booking and Discussion Forum & Member News
section5.body: Booking and discussion forums are available in the Members menu on the left. Member news is visible on the Home / Current page after logging in.

Manuals.label: Manuals
Manuals.title: Aircraft Manuals and Documents
Manuals.description1: Here are the club aircraft documents to assist with flight planning. Naturally, the official copies are in the respective aircraft, and we strive to keep these up to date. However, the possibility of human error always exists, so please verify the currency of documents before flight!
Manuals.description2: Please report any errors or deficiencies you notice to kalusto@mik.fi. Aircraft profiles are also available on the club's GitHub, so you can suggest changes if you wish.
Manuals.noticeText: Use of the aircraft requires understanding and compliance with the club's equipment instructions.

Instructions.label: Instructions
Instructions.title: Operational Instructions
Instructions.description: Flight operation guidelines and important documents for Malmi Aviation Club members.
Instructions.expenseInstructions: Submit completed expense reimbursement form by email to laskutus@mik.fi
Instructions.submissionInfo: Submit completed expense forms to the club treasurer.

pricingInfo.theoryInstruction: Theory instruction (per hour, divided among participants)

introduction.paragraph1: This checklist is primarily aimed at PPL students but applies to other training under our license. You'll have the same flight instructor until solo phase unless exceptional circumstances require a change.
introduction.paragraph2: If you feel you cannot continue with your current instructor, contact the chief flight instructor. You can submit feedback or reports anonymously via the club's mailbox (marked "TRAINING FEEDBACK/REPORT") or through the website form (currently unavailable).
introduction.importantNote: Please contact the chief flight instructor immediately if you believe safety was or could have been compromised, or if you have any observations about training or equipment.

beforeTraining.title: Before Training Begins
beforeTraining.item2: Training contract with Malmi Flying Club
beforeTraining.item3: Student license application (signed by chief flight instructor)
beforeTraining.item4: Ground school can be studied alongside flight training
beforeTraining.note: Note: Theory can be studied alongside flight training, but certain exams must be passed before first solo. Starting flight training late in autumn may not be advisable due to weather conditions.

beforeFirstFlight.title: Before First Flight Lesson
beforeFirstFlight.item1: Medical certificate copy in training folder
beforeFirstFlight.item2: Student license copy in training folder
beforeFirstFlight.item4: Ensure logbook and aircraft journey log are onboard for every flight

beforeSoloFlight.title: Requirements Before First Solo
beforeSoloFlight.item1: Passed exams: Aviation Regulations, Flight Theory, Radiotelephony
beforeSoloFlight.item4: Progress check flight with another instructor

beforeFlightTest.title: Before Flight Test
beforeFlightTest.item2: Completed ground and flight training certificates
beforeFlightTest.item5: If applicable: Failed flight test report

licenseApplication.title: License Application Documents
licenseApplication.description: The following documents must be included with your license application:
licenseApplication.note: Note: The official theory exam results should already be available to the authority, but include a copy for reference. Night rating cannot be included as part of LAPL(A)/PPL(A) training.
